thread.title: Constituents plan 'Texas Town Hall without Ted Cruz'
thread.title_full: Constituents plan 'Texas Town Hall without Ted Cruz'

author: Houston Chronicle
title: Constituents plan 'Texas Town Hall without Ted Cruz'
text:
Constituents plan 'Texas Town Hall without Ted Cruz' Houston Chronicle Tweets by cindylgeorge 
Texas Republicans in Congress face a dilemma during this week-long recess: Do they hold public events for constituents, risking a face-off with passionate proponents of the Affordable Care Act, or do they stick to private events and risk angering constituents? 
U.S. Sen. Ted Cruz has no in-person town halls scheduled this week. One group opposed to Cruz' support for President Donald Trump plans to make its voice heard at noon Tuesday outside the senator's Houston office during a " Texas Town Hall without Ted Cruz ." 
"We have called, written, faxed and e-mailed, organizer and Galveston resident Christy C. Callahan said in a news release. "We have reached out via social media. We have met with his staffers. Why won't our U.S. Senator meet face-to-face with us and hear our voices?" 
Chronicle reporter Cindy George will be at the event. Watch her live updates here. Latest from the Chron.com Homepage Click below for the top news from around the Houston area and beyond.
